title: Getting "Reprimanded" for having "Unknown Error"
body:
This past week, I have been getting unusually high ping times (300-500+ when I usually sit around 150~190) accompanied with lag going into champion select. I have also been kicked out of champion select with an "Unknown Error" and then unable to log back into League of Legends for 20+ minutes afterwards. All this time, I am getting "punished" for "abandoning a game" that I never actually got to play in because **_the game_** kicked me out.

I have: 
- reinstalled League of Legends
- disabled all firewalls and anti-virus software while running LoL.
- restarted my computer and router several times over the course of playing.
- tried connecting with a VPN.

none of the following have prevented this "Unknown Error" from kicking me out of the game. And I mean, I would really love to tell you more so I could fix it... but how am I supposed to know what's going on when the game itself calls it an "Unknown Error"?

replies.body:
Servers are currently throwing up their insides. It might not be your computer/your connection at all. Hold it out for a bit, and if it's still there, try again.

Do not connect to League with a VPN. It violates the EULA and could get your account banned.

Also, try [using an alternative DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5) to see if that's the issue.

Get back to me in a bit if it didn't work.
